result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyjerious T Young

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed.Pretrial Violation Report 11-01-2022

Defendant Tyjerious T Young in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Tyjerious T Young.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Court addresses Justice Point violations. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. Court further admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Court orders case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference date before Br 16 and a Preliminary Hearing date before prelim court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10.31.22
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 10-27-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 10.10.22

Defendant Tyjerious T Young in court.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for an indigency hearing.  Court holds colloquy with Mr. Young who indicated that the State Public Defender's Office called the previous week, and he accepted their services.   Court finds good cause to allow SPD's Office to continue to look for an attorney to appoint.  State Public Defender's Office notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Tyjerious T Young in court in person.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD informed the court that the defendant is refusing their services. Defendant has not retained counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing to the trial court.
Indigency hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Tyjerious T Young in court, without counsel, not in custody.  Present in court is Justice Point Alyssa Green.  Annie Louk for Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Justice Point Violation.  Defendant to report to Justice Point in a few days for drug screening test; Justice Point to notify court if negative results.  No action taken at this time.  Preliminary hearing remains calendared for September 23, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Defendant Tyjerious T Young in court, without counsel, out of custody.  Annie Louk for Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for indigency hearing.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing.  Defendant initially declined appointment of counsel but changed mind.  Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Supervision Report 08-19-2022

Defendant Tyjerious T Young in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant was not able to hire a private. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a indigency hearing in the trial court.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

22RM037182  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFF
08/02/2022
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-actor: Khalem Gaston

Defendant Tyjerious T Young in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Tyjerious T Young in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyjerious T Young appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
